comments.body: No I don't think they should add that.
No iron golem that’s to OP but the rest is fine
Probably not build golems, but I would be down if they placed blocks in addition to picking them up
They already place blocks xWolfhidex
I think it would be nice to have endermen build some kind of simple structure, such as small pillars and shrines, or a simple hut
The Piglins in sieges should also fight Blaze's and they should have some Piglin Brutes.

I love this idea! I mean imagine finding a nether fortress being attacked by an army of Piglins and Piglins brutes. Perhaps they could have a ruined nether fortress structure that indicates it has already been seiged and destroyed just to add a bit more lore
osea piglins?
Demasiado roto en mi opinión
That they are not villagers, but a different race
Or just farm the crops yourself and give them to the villagers.
Mobgriefing rule should have separate rules for hostile vs friendly mobs.

To anyone thinking that you can just farm it yourself and give the food to villagers: That's also disabled. 

That rule seems to have been setup in such a way as to completely discourage using it.. 

By using this rule you: 
- Disable sheeps from eating grass/regrowing their wool. (At least in tight spaces)
- Disable the ability to barter with piglins. (They may accept right-clicked gold)
- Disable villager farming and item pickup. 
- Disable any mobs from picking up items, including zombies and foxes. 
- Disable the snow trail of snow golems. 

All just to disable creepers, ghasts, and maybe endermen (for those who dislike that behavior), and bosses from destroying/moving items.
mejor que ellos se queden en la aldea y que sirva para vigilar las amenazas afectadas.

I’d suggest multiple methods that traders can become villagers. If all their pack animals are  killed they should have a random chance of becoming a villager. If they are in an existing village or come in contact with an existing villager they should have a random chance of becoming a villager. As the OP said, it’d make traders less annoying by making it easier to create new villagers where we want them.
Good idea! I think minecraft needs to expand on ice and snow related things!

I've always wanted a snow golem variant that can actually do damage. Having a ranged utility mob obtainable in survival would allow players to defend their property so much better, regardless of how the golems are created.

I think The permafrost snow golem should be made out of Blue ice
Instead of snow
I like it, but the ice balls are a tiny bit OP. also the freezing potion should last for 10-30 seconds.

Great idea! Though I have a slightly different idea on how to make them. One could use powdered snow and a white pumpkin (which as many have suggested should be in the Pale Garden), to create the permafrost golem.

The reason it uses powdered snow and a white golem is to encourage the player to travel around, as it requires materials in the mountains and pale gardens. Creating a frost golem would have its own achievement called “Frosty Snowman”

Meh, I personally like the way they look now. Maybe, that's just a nostalgia thing or something. I don't know. Maybe, this should be under add-ons for a texture pack. Anyways, keep up the good work! *Thumbs Up* And have fun doing so! :D

I think that it should give experience as well, similar to normal trading. It should have no trade limit, meaning you can instantly convert many emeralds into experience. I have posted something like this a long time ago, before the feedback website existed, and IMO this idea is underrated.
You can however already buy xp bottles from villagers... So that would render that trade useless.
But bottle o enchanting is more expensive, is a master level trade, and has a limit. Clerics aren't that easy to level up.
True, I guess. And I suppose it would only be the tiniest trickle of xp then anyway.
Kind of like refugee villagers? I like this idea.
refugee villagers? never heard of them but thanks!
minecraft dosn't really have mobs with gender so this dosnt really make sense. if this were to be implemented i would suggest half snake half villager. please take this into consideration.
not half snake half villager, just half snake half humanoid with hair.
also you should be able to escape their suffocation by using a fishing rod
How different would this be from the mason?
The Potter could also sell pottery sherds.
maybe also when you make one. but it has to be a perfect copy.
it is unsafe to tell people your age. still, i voted
I think that every villager killed than a baby will spawn.
Ok
Excellent idea, nothing sadder then an empty village. No spider webs no zombies just empty. Or maybe since villagers wander out - they can wander back in?

I like this, but early raids like this would probably cripple a player's village. Maybe the raids in the first few in-game weeks are the weakest, and later on once the player should have acquired better equipment, the raids may be able to grief walls.
They should be able to burn stuff
Would you be punished for just looking through the chest? or would it be less risky just to look through the chest than steal.
I like that idea
Like We Spawn A villager And Then They start working like chomping down tree's and stuff! Then Like 2 Weeks later that Villager Has Made A Village! And You can See The villager Make The houses!
I totally agree i was thinking about that same idea
Priests prey!

Masons could go inspect nearby stone.

Fletchers could go talk to the butcher (to get feathers).

Also, as long as we're on the topic of adding more detail to villager behavior, here are some other ideas.

When Fishermen fish, they would throw back undesirable fish and junk and give treasures to Clerics.

Clerics (occasionally) could be seen under the effects of random potions.

Armorers could repair iron golems (a little bit).

butchers could buy sheep from shepherds to slaughter, and the shepherd could actually breed new sheep.

maybe fishermen could ride boats too.

Ok, some things that the villagers could do could include: 

Clerics can brew and sell potions, but only after the ingredients were traded with them

Fishermen don't go to their barrels to sell fish, the fish are "stored" in there (only villagers could take them) and FIshermen would go to their docks and fish like usual, Like what Daniel Black said earlier, where they would take their treasure to the priests and the junk to the ocean again

Nitwits would spend the day picking flowers, annoying the working community, and play with the children

Librarians would teach the children (and the adults) and if they are successful, then the villager would either,  one) Not become a nitwit (if they were going too) or two) level up in the first profession that they become (I say that because the player could put one station and then put another one after breaking the first)

butchers would take the cattle from the pens and slaughter them (kinda like the ones from Tektopia)

The Shepard would be replaced with the Keeper. They would breed the animals in the pens around the village and would ask for breedable items (wheat, seeds, carrots, etc...) and would sell the main things Shepards would sell. They would also give the butcher animals to kill.

The leatherworker would ask the butcher for any extra leather and would be shown to make leather armour, saddles, and anything else

 

I had more to say but this extends the 1500 word limit

Создатели minecraft заявили о том что жители пацифисты поэтому мясник лучше будет не убивать а разводить животных, кстати я публиковал такой же пост, и забыл про картографа кстати твоя идея с ним крутая может он может путешествовать бы
Just no just no
Good idea. But Why Dark Fire balls there’s the ender dragons fireballs why not use those? I’m not trying to give hate just a idea
Nice but this should been in mobs right
Last I checked humanoids didn’t have multiple flame-throwing arms hovering around them.
I don’t think so.  The End is lacking in mob variety, though.

That's basically a shulker- at least that mob seems the ender counterpart of the blaze.

Also if such a mob would be added, 1: where in the end would it spawn,

2: what would it drop apart from end rods - any rare drops and how much XP does it drop,

3: since it is a dark version of a blaze, would it fight with its light counterparts if they met - a dark vs light blaze battle would look epic,

4: what would it be made of? - Blazes are made of fire and thermal energy, so they don't take fire damage and also burn and give off light by themselves, so what would the Razer be made of... Ender acid? Ender dragon breath? Molten Endstone and purpur blocks? Would it take fire damage?

Finally... if this is an end mob, then would it fly like a Blaze, or would it teleport like most ender mobs?

Then comes the part of, how much damage it would deal on what difficulty, and how hard will it be to destroy - will it be immune to any effects or attacks?

This has potential... but then again this comment comes from someone who loves blazes, so it may be a bit biased. I like the idea but it needs MORE detail. Otherwise we may as well just assume the shulker plays this role in the end.
It would have to teleport because a blaze is basically stealing iron mans moves because it thrusts itself upward

Illagers can trade the same currency but their trades are awesome.they have a new enemy which are rouges who take the roles of vindicator and pillager.along with witches too.who are lead by the evoker.this means raids will happen but are harder

The mansions will be taken over by the exiled AKA evoker and his gang.the illagers (the good illagers) live in villages and outposts.now villages will be bigger and the houses fancier.outposts will have huts and cabins.both structures will inhabit illagers and villagers
You will enjoy part 2 because it will be jam packed.I’m keeping raids and I’m changing a lot around.
I think priests are a bit much

ok librarians then.

if anything needs changing let me know and I’ll fix it.

Too me the illagers are a mystery.in my eyes this race are good people yet mistreated and corrupted by evil.the arch illager wanted rid of those who wronged him and likely alot of individuals wronged him and many of the members of the illager race

they were once respectful and kind hearted folks from colder countries,different from villagers due to them being hefty and fearless.

They never traveled away from their country but knew there was land with different soil and different people SO they packed their bags to find new land.they did after weeks of searching and they found people with similarities to them.

Unfortunately these people did not take kindly and thought the illagers were a disease which the illagers took offence too which caused them to hide away.then when the arch illager rose to power thats when war was declared

So the illagers have levels the more you trade or the more they survive battles and the more kills they have the more exp they will earn and the more highly trained they’ll become.you can raise illagers to become amazing soldiers.they will automatically equip gear but sometimes they’ll spawn with it

illagers who aren’t soldiers but are still neutral can get jobs too but are different to villagers despite using the same station

Or another reason that someone told me is because the illagers were never corrupt.the villagers resisted further development on what defines the society they live in.the illagers wanted more and the villagers excited them in the wilderness to die.

then once the illagers rose up and became a force to be reckoned with they turned to war.
There are many reasons why the villagers and illagers hate each other
real! and there should be some women too
Like have new villagers/village for example dark skin villagers in wooded badlands brown skin on beach island
A way to lock all crafting stations to prevent villagers linking to them when they are used for decoration. This would make moving villagers around a less frustrating experience.
I do agree on the front of players taking advantage of this but i think it should be done in a different way.
Perhaps all diamond-related items can’t be found in village chest anymore? That’s one nerf I can think of

Doing this to one or two villagers is really easy but if you have a lot of villagers this quickly becomes very expensive with all the gold needed for the gold apples so I think that players who can get all this gold should be rewarded with cheaper trades and this change would take that away. Gold already useless enough in the late game. Don't take away one of the few uses it has and don't vote for this idea.
I think that is a very good idea! I have been wanting jungle villages, and a swamp village sounds cool. I'm not so sure about communicating with villagers, though.
Yeah, I don't know where I was going with the communication part now that I think about it.
I think we should add more villagers such as a carpenter that allows us wood options and a beekeeper allowing us to have more interactions with the bees.
So true what about a way to spawn them
then villagers might have un abondend minechafts that are connected to the village
This is excellent. Voted! I love the ideas that bring more personality to villagers. Maybe, also, nitwits could play tag with kids? Or they could ring the bell randomly for fun?

I love it! Imagine, it's a normal day in the village, and all of a sudden, the bell starts ringing! Everyone runs to their houses, expecting a raid or some other danger, but after a while of nothing happening, they realize it was just a prankster nitwit.
This is a wonderful idea! I suggested villager job animations, but you've taken villagers to the next level! I love this!
Good idea but I think the warden should stay hostile
